column2: NEW YORK PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: New York
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. For better visibility during rain, fog or snow, use:
column4: high beam headlights.
column6: emergency flashers.
column8: low beam headlights.
column10: daytime lights.

column2: 2. Drivers who drive while intoxicated or impaired by drugs and cause the death of a child less than 16 years of age in the vehicle may be charged with a class B felony, punishable by up to ________ in State prison.
column4: 50 years
column6: 10 years
column8: 2 years
column10: 25 years

column2: 3. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 4. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: to signal all lane changes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 5. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column10: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 7. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 8. These are:
column4: regulatory signs.
column6: miles-left signs.
column8: route signs.
column10: speed limit signs.

column2: 9. In New York State, leaving the scene of an incident that involves a fatality or personal injury is:
column4: a criminal violation.
column6: permitted only if you were not directly involved in the crash.
column8: a traffic violation.
column10: permitted only if you did not cause the crash.

column2: 10. What does this ‘DIP’ sign indicate?
column4: Police DIPartment ahead.
column6: Downgrade ahead. Drivers should go slowly.
column8: There is a low place in the road.
column10: There is a Drive-In Parking ahead.

column2: 11. When you perform rescue breathing, you should:
column4: look for the victim's chest to rise.
column6: give one breath every fifteen seconds.
column8: never press the victim’s nostrils together.
column10: not stop rescue-breathing, even if the victim can breath.

column2: 12. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from both directions.
column6: vehicles from the left.
column8: vehicles from the right.
column10: pedestrians only.

column2: 13. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column10: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 14. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 15. What is the average total stopping distance of a tractor+trailer with hot brakes?
column4: 193 feet
column6: 683 feet
column8: 243 feet
column10: 430 feet

column2: 16. Vehicles may travel in lanes beneath the green arrow signal, but drivers must:
column4: turn left if they can.
column6: also obey all other signs and signals.
column8: never change lane.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 17. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column10: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.

column2: 18. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 19. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column6: indicate HOV lanes.
column8: indicate reserved lanes.
column10: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 20. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column10: None of the above.
